data.name: StrMassive

data.name: StrWaterPoer
data.value: Water, power, community and commerce. We keep things flowing.
data.comment: StrWaterPower for Water, power, community and commerce. We keep things flowing.

data.name: TxtMission
data.value: Plan, develop, maintain, and operate a reliable, secure, safe, and cost effective distribution system in Abu Dhabi and deliver services that meet or exceed our customers’ expectations.

data.name: TxtOverview
data.value:
Established in November 1998, Abu Dhabi Distribution Company (ADDC) is responsible for distributing high quality water and electricity services to all customers in the emirate of Abu Dhabi, excluding the Al Ain region. ADDC’s core business is the planning, design, construction, and operation of the Abu Dhabi water and electricity distribution network.
ADDC’s customer base is comprised of 412,540 service agreements for the supply of water and/or electricity, which is distributed to customers at the 33 kV and 11 kV levels throughout three regions: Eastern Region (Mussaffah and Baniyas), Western Region (Liwa, Silla) and Abu Dhabi Island.
ADDC is a Public Joint Stock Company that provides a regulated service, with revenues allowed by the Regulation & Supervision Bureau (RSB), the entity responsible for licensing and monitoring the performance of all sector companies. The RSB’s oversight of ADDC is done in the interest of customers, and limits are placed on the amount of revenue ADDC can earn in a particular year via the application of price controls that provide incentives for ADDC to improve the quality of service to customers while reducing costs.
ADDC’s license is subject to price control periods which are established every few years. The RSB has already commenced the consultation process with ADDC to establish new price controls that will take effect January 1st, 2010.

data.name: TxtValue
data.value: Achieving ADDC vision requires us to permeate our core values throughout the organization in order to enable us to deliver sustainable business results. Our core values include:

data.name: TxtVision
data.value: ADDC becomes a leading water and electricity distribution and supply company comparable with the top quartile performers worldwide by 2020.

data.name: str_select_property
data.value: Select the accounts to pay their outstanding bills

data.name: str_myprof_data
data.value: It is critical that we have your right details to continue providing you with our best possible service. Kindly use this to update us, should you need to make any more changes.

data.name: str_bill_language_myprofile
data.value: Which language you would prefer us to use?

data.name: str_contctnum_desc
data.value: If you include more than one number, then we will use the first one to send you SMS alerts and service updates; please make sure it is a local mobile.

data.name: payment_secure
data.value: All transactions on ADDC are encrypted and 100% secure.If you are having difficulties completing this form, or would like further information, please contact us at 800 – 2332.

data.name: min_max_payment
data.value: You can pay the amount between AED 5 to AED 1000000

data.name: str_try_again
data.value: Some error happen please try again later.

data.name: str_bill_language
data.value: Please select which language you prefer when we communicate with you:

data.name: str_bill_top_desc
data.value: This shows you whose name the bill is in and which property it is for.

data.name: str_bill_custsupport_desc
data.value: This shows you what channels you can use to contact ADDC customer support team.

data.name: str_meter_title_desc
data.value: Here you’ll find everything you need to know about your electricity meter.

data.name: str_meter_desc1
data.value: Every meter has a unique number, which allows us to track the amount of electricity you have used since your last bill and to generate the next one.

data.name: str_meter_desc2
data.value: This shows you the reading that we have based your bill on. If we haven’t been able to take an actual reading, this may be an estimated figure, based on your typical previous usage, in which case you’ll see an E next to the reading.

data.name: str_meter_desc3
data.value: The number you see here shows how many units of electricity you have used since your last bill. We multiply this by the unit rate from your tariff to work how your balance.

data.name: str_meter_desc4
data.value: This is the most recent date that we’re able to get a read from your meter, his can happen automatically or through a technician visit.

data.name: str_meter_desc5
data.value: This corresponds to the number of days within this billing period.

data.name: str_bill_middle_top_header_desc
data.value: This section sets out any payments or charges since your last bill and the amount of electricity you have used since then.

data.name: str_sum_desc1
data.value: This reminds you of the outstanding amount from your previous bill. It may show as a credit or a debit balance.

data.name: str_sum_desc2
data.value: Any payments you have made to this account since your previous bill was issued are shown here.

data.name: str_sum_desc3
data.value: Here you’ll see the credit or debit amount that has been carried over to this bill; it’s simply the previous balance less any.

data.name: str_bill_middle_bottom_cont
data.value: Just for your information, this shows the subsidy that has been applied to your account and what the actual cost of the electricity you’ve used would have been without it.

data.name: str_btp_title4_desc
data.value: Here you’ll see the current balance of your account, which includes any outstanding amount carried over from your previous bill. This is the amount that you are due to pay.

data.name: str_cust_title1
data.value: In this section you’ll find all the key reference numbers linked to your account. You might need these to set up an online account or pay a bill. It also shows the date your bill was issued and when it needs to be paid by.

data.name: str_cust_desc1
data.value: This is your personal reference number linked to your ADDC account. If you have more than one account with us, the same ID number will be used across them all.

data.name: str_cust_desc2
data.value: This number is specific to your ADDC electricity account at the property shown. Every different account you have with us will have a different account number.

data.name: str_cust_desc3
data.value: A unique 14 digit number used to identify every bill.

data.name: str_cust_desc4
data.value: The date on which the bill is to be paid.

data.name: str_cust_desc5
data.value: The maximum permissible date by which the customer needs to be paid.

data.name: str_cust_desc6
data.value: This refers to the spatial unit or the enclosed structure to which the utility services have to be rendered. And is identified by a unique premise ID.

data.name: str_btp_title1
data.value: Total to pay:Here you’ll see the current balance of your account, which includes any outstanding amount carried over from your previous bill. This is the amount that you are due to pay.

data.name: str_btp_desc1
data.value: A unique 14 digit number used to identify every bill.

data.name: str_btp_desc2
data.value: The account number is 10 digit number registered with ADDC.

data.name: str_btp_desc3
data.value: The date on which the bill is to be paid.

data.name: str_btp_desc4
data.value: The total that is due for payment for the given account number.

data.name: str_bill_num_right_desc
data.value: This is a referance number consists of 12 digits which can be used to pay the bills and to identify the account number.

data.name: str_bill_latest_middle_bottom_desc
data.value: This section shows you what is the actual cost incurred at the defined rate, subsidies if applicable. And finally what customer needs to pay post including other charges, adjustments/corrections.

data.name: str_meter_watertitle_desc
data.value: Here you’ll find everything you need to know about your water meter.

data.name: str_meter_water_desc1
data.value: Every meter has a unique number, which allows us to track the amount of water you have used since your last bill and to generate the next one.

data.name: str_meter_water_desc3
data.value: The number you see here shows how many units of water you have used since your last bill. We multiply this by the unit rate from your tariff to work how your balance.

data.name: str_bill_middle_top_header_water_desc
data.value: This section sets out any payments or charges since your last bill and the amount of water you have used since then.

data.name: str_water_bottom_desc1
data.value: Just for your information, this shows the subsidy that has been applied to your account and what the actual cost of the water you’ve used would have been without it.

data.name: str_bill_water_right
data.value: This number is specific to your ADDC water account at the property shown. Every different account you have with us will have a different account number.

data.name: str_under_bill_desc
data.value: We want to make sure you’re completely clear about what you’re paying and why, so we’ve designed our bills to be as straightforward as possible. This page explains the different information we show on your bill and how we’ve worked out what you need to pay us.

data.value: Please enter your username in the following field and click SUBMIT to receive an email with the new password.

data.name: str_all_mandatory
data.value: Please enter all the required fields.

data.name: str_actv_message
data.value: If you have already activated your account for the ADDC eServices website you can use the same details to log in. Otherwise, to activate your account simply enter your Emirates ID number here. we will then send the PIN to the mobile number and email ID.

data.name: str_customer_care
data.value: For further enquiries, please get in touch with our contact centre at 800-2332. We're happy to help you out.

data.name: str_not_received_pin
data.value: In case you haven't received the PIN, then click on Resend PIN

data.name: str_receive_pin
data.value: Please enter your new PIN and click on SUBMIT:

data.name: str_validate_pin_text1
data.value: We have sent the PIN to your registered mobile

data.name: str_wrong_emirates_id
data.value: Emirates ID is in a wrong format.

data.name: str_payfrnd_note_desc
data.value: If you’re Residential, Agricultural or Commercial Account holder, you can pay your bills by credit or debit card. A processing fee will apply as AED 2.25% plus AED 1.50 for each transaction to all Commercial Account payment.

data.name: str_select_account_details
data.value: Click on account number to view details

data.name: str_water_tips_desc
data.value: Water is one of the most essential elements that we need in our everyday lives. United Arab Emirates suffers from a scarce rainfall season, therefore, it is very important for us to monitor the overall consumption of water, whether it was inside or outside our homes, at school or at the workplace.

data.name: str_elec_tips_desc
data.value: Electricity is one of the most important resources and one of the discoveries that modern civilization relies heavily upon. Just like any other needed resource, it is important that we learn how to conserve usage of electricity.

data.name: str_elec_save_steps
data.value: Below are some simple steps that each one of us can follow to help save electricity.

data.name: str_reduce_water
data.value: How can we reduce water consumption at home?

data.name: str_wash_tip1
data.value: Turn off the tap while brushing your teeth and use a big glass of water instead of running water.

data.name: str_wash_tip2
data.value: Turn off the tap while washing your face or while shaving.

data.name: str_wash_tip3
data.value: Use a water flow regulator to reduce the amount of water consumed.

data.name: str_shower_tip1
data.value: Use the shower instead of filling the basin with water. If you insist on using it, make sure you do not over fill it.

data.name: str_shower_tip3
data.value: Use spray regulator or a bolt to stop water flow while washing.

data.name: str_kitchen_tip1
data.value: Wash fruits and vegetables in a water filled basin or bowl to reduce water consumption while washing.

data.name: str_kitchen_tip2
data.value: Leave frozen foods out for a proper amount of time to defrost instead of pouring water over them.

data.name: str_kitchen_tip3
data.value: Use the exact amount of water needed for drinking purposes or coffee or tea preparation.

data.name: str_kitchen_tip4
data.value: When washing dishes, it is preferable to wash them in a basin filled with water. As for the dishes that need vigorous cleaning, it is recommended to soak the dishes in water for a short amount of time before washing them.

data.name: str_kitchen_tip5
data.value: Make sure that the dishwashing machine is fully loaded before turning it on. It is useless turning the machine on for one or two plates.

data.name: str_kitchen_tip6
data.value: Taps and water pipes should be checked on a regular basis to detect any possible leakage

data.name: str_garden_tip
data.value: Use the spray or drip irrigation system for irrigation to limit the consumption of water. Both methods are considered modern methods that use the least amount of water.

data.name: str_wash_car_tip
data.value: It is recommended to use at least two buckets of water to wash your car instead of using a water hose.

data.name: str_swimming_pool_tips
data.value: Swimming pools consumes large amount of water especially when they are big in size. Therefore it is recommended to follow these useful tips:

data.name: str_swimming_pool_tip1
data.value: Always make sure that the water level in the swimming pool is low.

data.name: str_swimming_pool_tip2
data.value: Cover the swimming pool with a suitable shade to decrease evaporation rate.

data.name: str_swimming_pool_tip3
data.value: Check the walls of the swimming pool and the drainage system constantly to monitor any leakage.

data.name: str_school_tip1
data.value: Never use water as a playing tool.

data.name: str_school_tip2
data.value: Inform your teacher in case of leakage.

data.name: str_school_tip3
data.value: Advise the gardener to use spray irrigation techniques.

data.name: str_ac_tip1
data.value: Conduct inspection and maintenance activities on a regular basis to ensure the air conditioner is operating efficiently and effectively.

data.name: str_ac_tip2
data.value: Clean the filter once every two weeks. This helps produce cleaner, cooler air and enables lower consumption of electricity.

data.name: str_ac_tip3
data.value: Close any holes around the AC unit to prevent any leakage of air, which in turn reduces consumption.

data.name: str_ac_tip4
data.value: Install curtains around the windows to minimize the entry of external heat and reduce the consumption of light as much as possible.

data.name: str_ac_tip5
data.value: Set the thermometer in the AC unit at 25 degrees Celsius and not below that level.

data.name: str_water_saver1
data.value: Water Saver helps in reducing the overall amount of water consumed by the individual. The water saver mixes the water coming out of the tap with air which automatically reduces the amount of water leaving the tap but still feels like you are using the same amount used before.

data.name: str_water_saver2
data.value: The water saver can be installed behind the showerhead. In addition, you can also install a bolt that is used to control water flow which can either be turned on or off when taking a shower.

data.name: str_water_saver4
data.value: There are Two Sections in the Water Meter

data.name: str_water_saver_tip1
data.value: One section is white with figures in black.

data.name: str_water_saver_tip2
data.value: The other section is red with figures in white.

data.name: str_water_saver5
data.value: Any figure in the white section refers to cubic meter or unit. The units for figures in the red section are liters.

data.name: str_water_saver_tip3
data.value: Read the meter for two consecutive days.

data.name: str_water_saver_tip4
data.value: Subtract the first reading form the second reading.

data.name: str_water_saver_tip5
data.value: The difference between the two readings indicates the consumption of one day.

data.name: str_water_saver_tip6
data.value: If the difference between the two readings is for more that one day, it should be divided by number of days to get the daily consumption and number of persons to get consumption per capita.

data.name: str_water_saver7
data.value: How to Calculate Consumption for One Day

data.name: str_water_saver9
data.value: Number of days between the two readings = 30 days

data.name: str_water_saver10
data.value: Number of family members is five

data.name: str_water_saver11
data.value: Consumption, the difference between the two readings, is 45 cubic meters

data.name: str_water_saver12
data.value: Daily consumption = 45/30 = 1.5 cubic meter / day support number of the family members is 5

data.name: str_water_saver13
data.value: Consumption per capita = 1.5/5 = 0.3 cubic meter/ person/day

data.name: str_home_app1
data.value: Home appliances such as washing machines, driers, irons and others should be used at non-peak hours whenever possible.

data.name: str_home_app_tip2
data.value: Do not open the refrigerator doors repetitively, especially during the summer season. Keep cold water in an insulated thermos outside the refrigerator. This gives kids, in particular, one less reason to open the refrigerator.

data.name: str_home_app_tip3
data.value: Place the refrigerator in the coolest area of the kitchen. Avoid the warmer spots, especially those that are sunlit or near the oven.

data.name: str_home_app_tip4
data.value: Avoid operating the refrigerator at maximum temperatures. Adjust the temperature to moderate levels that can keep food just as fresh

data.name: str_home_app_tip5
data.value: Avoid operating the washing machine on a daily basis, when possible. Operate the washing machine when the load is medium to heavy. This helps save electricity as well as water

data.name: str_home_app_tip6
data.value: Machines that warm up water use up to six times more electricity compared with normal machines

data.name: str_home_app5
data.value: Avoid operating all the appliances at once, especially at peak hours (13.00 pm – 16.00pm and 22.00pm – 01.00am). This helps balance electricity load/consumption and prevents potential damage of the machines

data.name: str_home_app6
data.value: The table below reflects the amount of power consumption for other home appliances:

data.name: str_save_light_tip1
data.value: Switch off the lights when you exit the room.

data.name: str_save_light_tip2
data.value: Switch off the lights in rooms that are not occupied.

data.name: str_save_light_tip3
data.value: Switch off the lights during the day as it is beneficial to rely on sunlight during the day.

data.name: str_save_light_tip4
data.value: Paint the walls with light colors. Light colors reflect light, thereby intensifying the amount of light present in the room.

data.name: str_save_light_tip5
data.value: Use specific lamps that require less electric power to operate. These include fluorescent lamps and power saving lamps.

data.name: str_save_light_tip6
data.value: Use insulating glass for windows. This enables the entry of the largest amount of natural light and in turn reduces the amount of electricity needed.

data.name: str_save_light_tip7
data.value: Power savings lamps use up to 80% less power consumption when compared with ordinary lamps. In addition, they produce less heat, thereby requiring less energy consumption by air conditioning units.

data.name: str_save_light_tip8
data.value: The life time of power saving lamps is eight times that of the ordinary lamps. For example, if the lifetime of a normal bulb is 1000 hours, then the lifetime of power saving bulb is 8000 hours.

data.name: str_save_light2
data.value: The table below shows the difference in Watt usage between ordinary lamps and power savings lamps. Lower Watt usage means lower energy consumption and therefore, lower bill payment

data.name: str_about_value_content
data.value: Achieving ADDC vision requires us to permeate our core values throughout the organization in order to enable us to deliver sustainable business results. Our core values include:

data.name: str_about_value_point1
data.value: Ensure provision of water and electricity with the highest levels of quality, safety and excellence.

data.name: str_about_value_point2
data.value: Demonstrate professionalism in all customer dealings

data.name: str_about_value_point3
data.value: Ensure that all business actions are driven by customer needs

data.name: str_about_value_point4
data.value: Operate the business following the highest ethical and moral standards

data.name: str_about_value_point5
data.value: Honor commitments and treat everyone fairly and with respect

data.name: str_about_value_point7
data.value: Provide a healthy and safe workplace

data.name: str_about_value_point8
data.value: Focus on recruiting, developing and retaining a skilled workforce

data.name: str_about_value_point10
data.value: Empower people to maximize their potential and contribution and promote open and honest communication

data.name: str_about_value_point11
data.value: and promote open and honest communication

data.name: str_about_value_point12
data.value: Strive to achieve the highest possible standards in day-to-day work and in the quality of the outcomes produced

data.name: str_about_value_point13
data.value: Value the skills, strengths, and perspectives of a diverse team and promote cross-division teaming

data.name: str_about_value_point14
data.value: Promote a participatory workplace that enables people to get involved in making decisions about their work that contributes towards common business objectives

data.name: str_about_value_point15
data.value: Demonstrate corporate social responsibility by integrating community and social values in the development of corporate business planning

data.name: str_about_value_point16
data.value: Partner with other organizations and interest groups for the benefit of our society

data.name: str_about_value_point17
data.value: Participate in social and community awareness programs and campaigns

data.name: ariff_consumption_msg_green
data.value: A lower rate for using less than your daily allowance.

data.name: str_cal_desc
data.value: Results of calculations are approximations only.

data.name: tariff_consumption_msg
data.value: A higher rate for using more than your daily allowance.

data.name: tariff_info_body1
data.value: There are a number of things that help determine the amount that you pay: how much water and electricity you use, the type of property you live in, and whether you’re a UAE National or an expat. This page explains how it all works.

data.name: tariff_info_body3
data.value: Our residential tariffs are designed to encourage sustainable consumption. They’re divided into two different rates that affect your total bill. The Green Band is charged at a lower rate, up to a set daily allowance based on a calculated “ideal average” consumption. If you use more than this limit, you’ll be charged at a higher Red Band rate. So, if you stay in the green, you’ll pay less for each unit.For other tariffs follow these links:
